title: No children node listing when changing data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab
description: When changing the data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab, the children node listing does not appear. This occurs when creating a new data set without an SQL statement and the new data source does not have any database/table/column information.
OB: The children node listing does not appear when changing the data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab. This occurs when creating a new data set without an SQL statement and the new data source does not have any database/table/column information.
SR:
1. Create a new data set without an SQL statement.
2. Open the data set editor and navigate to the data source page.
3. Change the data source to a new one that does not have any database/table/column information.
4. Observe that the children node listing is not displayed.
5. Close the data set editor and reopen it.
